meanings.definition: A person who consigns goods to be sold or shipped.
meanings.sent1: The consignor dropped off her handmade crafts at the store to be sold.
meanings.sent2: The consignor shipped the vintage clothes to the online store for sale.
meanings.sent3: The consignor joked that she was now a professional crafter since she consigned her items.
meanings.sent4: As a consignor, she was like a silent partner in the business, letting her goods speak for themselves.
meanings.sent5: The consignor was like a fairy godmother, magically turning her items into cash for others.

meanings.definition: To deliver something to a consignor for sale or shipment.
meanings.sent1: She will consignor her artwork to the gallery for the upcoming exhibition.
meanings.sent2: He consignored the antique furniture to the auction house for bidding.
meanings.sent3: The artist consignored his paintings with a flourish, feeling like a true professional.
meanings.sent4: She consignored her worries to the universe, hoping for a positive outcome.
meanings.sent5: The consignoring of the package was like sending a little piece of herself out into the world.
